messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Off Topic-Chronic Fatigue  and other illness
messages.msgSnippet: Forgive me for not following this thread, but I just wanted to mention that I have a friend with chronic lyme disease who was misdiagnosed for years and who is
messages.messageBody:
Forgive me for not following this thread, but I just wanted to mention that
I have a friend with chronic lyme disease who was misdiagnosed for years and
who is very active in fund raising for lyme disease research. Apparently
there are doctors and medical researchers who believe that chronic fatigue
syndrome and/or fybromyalgia(spelling!) are really undiagnosed lyme disease!
I know little about it myself, however. Food for thought.
----- Original Message -----
From: "Shannon Brophy" <shannon@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 30, 2000 4:57 PM
Subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Off Topic-Chronic Fatigue and other
illness


> I got to hear
> Dr. Luc
> de Schepper speak, and I have a friend who studies in his school and have
> read his book too. He says that homeopathy is truly effective for ADD kids
> by looking at them as unique individuals and identifying physical, mental,
> and especially emotional symptoms and then precribing a remedy. I wanted
to
> mention that
> Chronic fatigue and other illness can be caused with wheat allergy. Celiac
> sprue (spelling?) disease means that those who suffer have to really cut
out
> all wheat and lots of other things like spices that have additives, and
even
> licking stamps-in order to get better. It is often missed by medical
people
> as a possibility, and can be tested for.
> Forgive me if it has been mentioned as I haven't been following the
> discussion closely.
> Shannon
